There are $n$ students and $m$ rooms. Each room has a different number of wash basins: room 1 has $a_1$ basins, room 2 has $a_2$ basins, and so on, up to room $m$ having $a_m$ basins.

Each student randomly chooses a room to go to.  Once all students have chosen a room, the students in each room line up in queues so that the longest queue is as short as possible.

What is the average (expected value) length of the longest queue across all the rooms?
There are students and rooms with a different number of sinks in each room. Each student randomly chooses a room.  Find the average length of the longest line of students waiting at a sink.
